intro: Elionurus muticus var. calvescens, commonly known as the slender leaved spurge, is a perennial herb native to arid and semi-arid regions of southern Africa. It is characterized by its narrow, linear leaves and small, yellowish-green flowers that appear in clusters. The plant typically grows from a caudex, a thickened rootstock, and has a low-growing, spreading habit. It is adapted to withstand drought conditions and is often found in rocky or sandy soils. The species is noted for its chemical composition, which includes various latex-producing compounds.
